meanings.definition: To dismantle or take apart a structure.
meanings.sent1: I will unbuild the Lego tower to create something new.
meanings.sent2: The workers will unbuild the old house to make space for a new one.
meanings.sent3: It's like playing a reverse puzzle when you unbuild a structure.
meanings.sent4: She unbuilds her fears brick by brick, gaining confidence with each piece removed.
meanings.sent5: The demolition crew unbuilds the building with precision and care.

meanings.definition: To undo the construction of a building.
meanings.sent1: The storm's strong winds threatened to unbuild the fragile house.
meanings.sent2: The architect had to unbuild the faulty section of the building and start over.
meanings.sent3: It felt like a magic trick to unbuild the building and watch it disappear.
meanings.sent4: The decision to unbuild the structure was like erasing a mistake and starting anew.
meanings.sent5: The construction crew had to unbuild the incorrect wall before continuing the project.
